content:
Here's the result of running `cat -n` on /workspace/problem_statement.txt:
     1	Folder Path /scikit-learn
     2	
     3	clone fails for parameters that are estimator types
     4	#### Description
     5	
     6	`clone` fails when one or more instance parameters are estimator types (i.e. not instances, but classes).
     7	
     8	I know this is a somewhat unusual use case, but I'm working on a project that provides wrappers for sklearn estimators (https://github.com/phausamann/sklearn-xarray) and I'd like to store the wrapped estimators as their classes - not their instances - as a parameter inside of a wrapper that behaves like an estimator itself.
     9	
    10	#### Steps/Code to Reproduce
    11	
    12	from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
    13	from sklearn.base import clone
    14	clone(StandardScaler(with_mean=StandardScaler))
    15	
    16	#### Expected Results
    17	
    18	No error.
    19	
    20	#### Actual Results
    21	```
    22	Traceback (most recent call last):
    23	...
    24	File "...\lib\site-packages\sklearn\base.py", line 62, in clone
    25	new_object_params[name] = clone(param, safe=False)
    26	File "...\lib\site-packages\sklearn\base.py", line 60, in clone
    27	new_object_params = estimator.get_params(deep=False)
    28	TypeError: get_params() missing 1 required positional argument: 'self'
    29	```
    30	
    31	#### Possible fix
    32	
    33	Change `base.py`, line 51 to:
    34	
    35	elif not hasattr(estimator, 'get_params') or isinstance(estimator, type):
    36	
    37	I'm not sure whether this might break stuff in other places, however. I'd happily submit a PR if this change is desired.
    38	
    39	#### Versions
    40	
    41	sklearn: 0.20.0
